title: UFO Sightings
text:
This data set consists of over 80,000 documented UFO sightings all over the world. Some variables include country, region, city, time, shape, and length of encounter. This graph compares the number of encounters between each country in the data set, highlighting the stark difference between the amount of sightings in the United States compared to everyone else.









The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/main/data/2019/2019-06-25
The original data set, from NUFORC (The National UFO Reporting Center), can be found at: https://nuforc.org/databank/

title: Thomas Matheis
text: Hey! I’m Tommy, a current first year at Pomona College. I love math and data science, and I’m excited to build upon my current knowledge in those fields. Outside of the classroom, I am a diver on Pomona-Pitzer’s Swimming & Diving team. My hobbies include listening to indie music, going on long drives, and mountain biking.

title: Starbucks
text:
This is the data set from Starbucks’ official 2021 nutritional information. Steamed milk data is omitted from this data set. The vizualization displays the relationship between the amount of sugar in a beverage and its calories. The color is organized by type of milk. It can be seen that drinks with more sugar typically have a higher calorie count.









The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/main/data/2021/2021-12-21
The current nutritional information, from the official Starbucks website, can be found at: https://www.starbucks.ie/sites/starbucks-ie-pwa/files/2025-01/Winter%20Beverage%20Nutritionals%20.pdf
